149
GUARANTEE AMONG HEIRS AFTER DIVISION
(1) All the heirs are responsible in accordance with an Act in the event someone else, with reference to a right arising prior to the division, takes an item of property assigned to an heir in his or her hereditary portion, or in any other way reduces this heir's right.
(2) Equally, the heirs shall guarantee that the items of property assigned to their portions do not have hidden faults.
(3) Heirs shall guarantee that a decedent's claim that fell to a share of one of the heirs actually exists and that it will be possible to collect it from the debtor up to the amount included in the portion.
(4) The obligation to guarantee the existence and recoverability of claims shall last three years after the division, and for claims which become due after the division, three years after they have become due.
(5) In all cases of a guarantee in accordance with this Article, each heir shall guarantee and owe compensation proportionate to his or her hereditary portion.
